title: Ford Ranger Raptor review: improbable, but this workhorse pick-up is a big bundle of fun
text:
There’s no mistaking the Ford Ranger Raptor, that’s for sure. It stands almost two metres tall and 2.2 metres wide, its dimensions exaggerated by big, chunky bumpers and wheel arch extensions. It is, in short – and by European, rather than US, standards, at least – gargantuan.

Its headlights sit almost at the height of most family hatchbacks’ roofs, while from the rear it’s impossible to miss the vast, girder-like bumper reinforcement on which sits the towbar.

Underneath it all, power comes from a 210bhp, 2.0-litre twin-turbocharged diesel, which isn’t quite as spectacular as the 444bhp, 3.5-litre V6 you’ll find in its bigger brother, the F150 Raptor. Nevertheless, it’s more than enough to allow...
description: There’s no mistaking the Ford Ranger Raptor, that’s for sure.
